revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 21:14:31.000000000', 'message': "Defer to use /proc/PID/cmdline when it mismatches exe

When setproctitle is used to change a command string, it
causes a problem where the rootwrap daemon incorrectly
matches the KillFilter since it's checking /proc/PID/exe first.
Change to always check /proc/PID/cmdline starts with
/proc/PID/exe and return it if it doesn't, assuming that
is the correct string match.

Change-Id: I1127113163bc5fd5013d78fef2336d378f1ddc02
"}]
commit_message:
Defer to use /proc/PID/cmdline when it mismatches exe

When setproctitle is used to change a command string, it
causes a problem where the rootwrap daemon incorrectly
matches the KillFilter since it's checking /proc/PID/exe first.
Change to always check /proc/PID/cmdline starts with
/proc/PID/exe and return it if it doesn't, assuming that
is the correct string match.

Change-Id: I1127113163bc5fd5013d78fef2336d378f1ddc02

commit_message:
zuul: move ceph jobs to non-voting

the ceph jobs are currently broken because of an upstream issue
with repos, let's move them to non-voting until this issue is
fixed.

Change-Id: Ie38593e963e5883f7975045f2d3d678996937122

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-13 13:08:02.000000000', 'message': "Added volume related keys to pod mounts to ease the overriding

If user wants to add an extra volumeMounts/volume to a pod,
amd uses override values e.g. like this

pod:
  mounts:
    nova_placement:
      init_container: null
      nova_placement:
        volumeMounts:
          - name: nova-etc
          ...

helm template parser complains with

Warning: The destination item 'nova_placement' is a table and ignoring the source 'nova_placement' as it has a non-table value of: <nil>

So when we create empty values for such keys in values.yaml, the source
will be present and warning does not need to be shown.

Change-Id: Ib8dc53c3a54e12014025de8fafe16fbe9721c0da
"}, {'created': '2019-03-15 06:15:12.000000000', 'message': "Added volume related keys to pod mounts to ease the overriding

Change-Id: Ib8dc53c3a54e12014025de8fafe16fbe9721c0da

commit_message:
Added volume related keys to pod mounts to ease the overriding

If user wants to add an extra volumeMounts/volume to a pod,
amd uses override values e.g. like this

pod:
  mounts:
    nova_placement:
      init_container: null
      nova_placement:
        volumeMounts:
          - name: nova-etc
          ...

helm template parser complains with

Warning: The destination item 'nova_placement' is a table and ignoring the source 'nova_placement' as it has a non-table value of: <nil>

So when we create empty values for such keys in values.yaml, the source
will be present and warning does not need to be shown.

Change-Id: Ib8dc53c3a54e12014025de8fafe16fbe9721c0da

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-06 13:31:25.000000000', 'message': 'Check hosts have no instances for AZ rename

Update aggregate and update aggregate metadata API calls have the
ability to update availability zone name for the aggregate. If the
aggregate is not empty (has hosts with instances on it)
the update leads to discrepancy for objects saving availability zone as a
string but not reference.

From devstack DB they are:
- cinder.backups.availability_zone
- cinder.consistencygroups.availability_zone
- cinder.groups.availability_zone
- cinder.services.availability_zone
- cinder.volumes.availability_zone
- neutron.agents.availability_zone
- neutron.networks.availability_zone_hints
- neutron.router_extra_attributes.availability_zone_hints
- nova.dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.instances.availability_zone
- nova.volume_usage_cache.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_instances.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_volume_usage_cache.availability_zone

Why that's bad?
First, API and Horizon show different values for host and instance for
example. Second, migration for instances with changed availability
zone fails with "No valid host found" for old AZ.

This change adds an additional check to aggregate an Update Aggregate API call.
With the check, it's not possible to rename AZ if the corresponding
aggregate has instances in any hosts.

PUT /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id} and
POST /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id}/action return HTTP 400 for
availability zone renaming if the hosts of the aggregate have any instances.
It's similar to conflicting AZ names error already available.

Change-Id: Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73
Closes-Bug: #1378904
(cherry picked from commit 8e19ef4173906da0b7c761da4de0728a2fd71e24)
'}]
commit_message:
Check hosts have no instances for AZ rename

Update aggregate and update aggregate metadata API calls have the
ability to update availability zone name for the aggregate. If the
aggregate is not empty (has hosts with instances on it)
the update leads to discrepancy for objects saving availability zone as a
string but not reference.

From devstack DB they are:
- cinder.backups.availability_zone
- cinder.consistencygroups.availability_zone
- cinder.groups.availability_zone
- cinder.services.availability_zone
- cinder.volumes.availability_zone
- neutron.agents.availability_zone
- neutron.networks.availability_zone_hints
- neutron.router_extra_attributes.availability_zone_hints
- nova.dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.instances.availability_zone
- nova.volume_usage_cache.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_instances.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_volume_usage_cache.availability_zone

Why that's bad?
First, API and Horizon show different values for host and instance for
example. Second, migration for instances with changed availability
zone fails with "No valid host found" for old AZ.

This change adds an additional check to aggregate an Update Aggregate API call.
With the check, it's not possible to rename AZ if the corresponding
aggregate has instances in any hosts.

PUT /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id} and
POST /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id}/action return HTTP 400 for
availability zone renaming if the hosts of the aggregate have any instances.
It's similar to conflicting AZ names error already available.

Change-Id: Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73
Closes-Bug: #1378904
(cherry picked from commit 8e19ef4173906da0b7c761da4de0728a2fd71e24)

[{'created': '2019-03-08 10:43:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update image names

According to a meeting with portdirect, the convention for our
images is <imagename>:<tagging> where <tagging> takes the format
<version>-<distro>.

This make sure all the non-LOCI images are updated to this latest
pattern.

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-helm/%23openstack-helm.2019-03-07.log.html#t2019-03-07T17:50:58

Change-Id: Iccf07ba22a7c6bbc862a5fd2d0c08e004d60ac52
'}]
commit_message:
Update image names

According to a meeting with portdirect, the convention for our
images is <imagename>:<tagging> where <tagging> takes the format
<version>-<distro>.

This make sure all the non-LOCI images are updated to this latest
pattern.

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-helm/%23openstack-helm.2019-03-07.log.html#t2019-03-07T17:50:58

Change-Id: Iccf07ba22a7c6bbc862a5fd2d0c08e004d60ac52

commit_message:
Add init container to load apparmor profile

This patch place in a sample for an init container, generated by
helm toolkit, to load an apparmor profile included in the chart.

Change-Id: I309e3b550fd1d683745c319aa39bcfb96b77ea14
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

subject: Ceph plugin detects client.admin keyring

commit_message:
Ceph plugin detects client.admin keyring

In standard system locations, check for the client.admin key
for each detected Ceph cluster and conditionally suppress
Ceph agent checks that require it if it is not found.

Change-Id: If3a28ceb5cdde40749d077ad465054eba37c848c
Story: 2005172

pyldap should indeed die in a fire. Yet I believe that might impact existing people, so it might be worth discussing on the ML.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-04 10:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> pyldap should indeed die in a fire. Yet I believe that might impact

(Because of the fact that LOCI can be used to build older branches)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-04 10:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-04 10:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Maybe we can use a new profile, to match this depending on the branch to build? Like newton ocata pike queens, and have rocky and above using python-ldap.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-04 10:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (Because of the fact that LOCI can be used to build older branches)
feels like that is a problem of not currently using releases :('}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-04 15:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2019-03-05 17:50:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think it's time to start working on a stable branch to address issues like this."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:32:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I think it's time to start working on a stable branch to address
 > issues like this.

That sounds like a good deal. If we start to branch loci, a lot of things can disappear. The backports will, I think, be limited. But it's harder to consume though."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:33:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > I think it's time to start working on a stable branch to address
 > > issues like this.
 > 
 > That sounds like a good deal. If we start to branch loci, a lot of
 > things can disappear. The backports will, I think, be limited. But
 > it's harder to consume though.

An alternative could be to use profiles per openstack branch."}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2019-03-08 00:36:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Let's discuss in the meeting tomorrow. Seems like profiles will be a more elegant and maintainable solution."}, {'account_id': 9963, 'date': '2019-03-14 13:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-14 21:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-14 21:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-14 21:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Changed to use profiles. This way if nothing is passed to the profiles via openstach-helm-images build.sh script it still maintains the old state but if we pass rocky it will use the new one.

Still having branches would do away with this, because if not we will just keep increasing the versions accepted for python-ldap ad infinitum'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-14 22:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-15 08:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-15 11:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

If we go for branch named profiles, this can be simplified like my comment, while keeping compatibility with existing consumers.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-15 12:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-15 13:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-15 13:27:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Test it, and you'll see :)"}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-15 13:43:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-15 14:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2019-03-15 15:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-15 16:22:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I am ok with this.
It's a good stop gap that allows up to build things in OSH-images for multiple branches."}]

commit_message:
allow using python-ldap instead of pyldap

pyldap has been deprecated and merged back into python-ldap so
using pyldap should be used on versions lower than rocky

Change-Id: I3973d6a9d8156f305e4ea2f3ffbb831ee94156be

commit_message:
Switch to horizon-nodejs4-jobs template

We need to switch these jobs to xenial. But while we're doing that,
let's shift to consuming a template managed in the horizon repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/643198
Change-Id: I58404ec835f362faaa04df58bf23cd9fee1963c2

[nova] Do not throw out stdout of nova-manage --version

"nova-manage --version" used to print to stderr, but
at least since Rocky it prints to stdout

messages: [{'account_id': 24780, 'date': '2019-02-21 22:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24780, 'date': '2019-02-22 13:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-03-15 15:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2019-03-15 15:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 22:01:12.000000000', 'message': 'Kubernetes-keystone-webhook: Add security context

This adds the security context to the
kubernetes-keystone-webhook. This changes the default
user from root to the nobody user.
This also adds the container security context to
explicitly set allowPrivilegeEscalation to false

Change-Id: I54621e94f2866a4b4301baa6b570472c5fcda291
'}]
commit_message:
Kubernetes-keystone-webhook: Add security context

This adds the security context to the
kubernetes-keystone-webhook. This changes the default
user from root to the nobody user.
This also adds the container security context to
explicitly set allowPrivilegeEscalation to false

Change-Id: I54621e94f2866a4b4301baa6b570472c5fcda291

commit_message:
Adding text collector for i40e VF stats from node
The stats are generated by divingbell job and node-exporter picks
the stats from the host file system.

Change-Id: I0f73a6f3ca7e9d045832435410933bd630a8c686

commit_message:
Add python jobs to tripleo-image-elements

This change also fixes the python tests to properly mock the path so our
stubs work if the command already exists on the system path.

Change-Id: I7c54b1d99e7cf6c4e3f4ded8c518bf447b2ba1de

commit_message:
Switch to horizon-nodejs4-jobs template

We need to switch these jobs to xenial. But while we're doing that,
let's shift to consuming a template managed in the horizon repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/643198
Change-Id: Ie222177cafc5bbde984714a44e113cc538623aa9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 20:51:53.000000000', 'message': "Rationalize logging helpers and docs

shade and openstacksdk each have a logging doc and a logging setup helper
function. They both basically do the same thing, and we have a TODO item
about collapsing them.

This moves openstack.utils.enable_logging to openstack.enable_logging
(leaving behind a compat piece at openstack.utils.enable_logging) It
adds the shade functionality to it, and also changes the behavior to
match shade's WRT behavior when no parameters are passed (defaults to
logging to stdout)

Update the codebase to call openstack._log.setup_logging instead of
logging.getLogger directly, as setup_logging attaches a NullHandler by
default.

Collapse the docs into a single document.

There were only two places where openstacksdk was already logging to
something other than 'openstack'. Collapse those down to 'openstack'
until we come up with a reason to break them out more logically.

Change-Id: I45fd5ffd18255450d38a1f56c80f5c157ea19ae3

Change-Id: I45fd5ffd18255450d38a1f56c80f5c157ea19ae3
"}]
commit_message:
Rationalize logging helpers and docs

shade and openstacksdk each have a logging doc and a logging setup helper
function. They both basically do the same thing, and we have a TODO item
about collapsing them.

This moves openstack.utils.enable_logging to openstack.enable_logging
(leaving behind a compat piece at openstack.utils.enable_logging) It
adds the shade functionality to it, and also changes the behavior to
match shade's WRT behavior when no parameters are passed (defaults to
logging to stdout)

Update the codebase to call openstack._log.setup_logging instead of
logging.getLogger directly, as setup_logging attaches a NullHandler by
default.

Collapse the docs into a single document.

There were only two places where openstacksdk was already logging to
something other than 'openstack'. Collapse those down to 'openstack'
until we come up with a reason to break them out more logically.

Change-Id: I45fd5ffd18255450d38a1f56c80f5c157ea19ae3
